name: Rhodeia of Loch
desc:
"Lady of Clear Waters" Rhodeia

"As long as rain falls and rivers flow… water will exist forever…"

value.name: Streaming Surge
value.desc:
Flowing

The racing waters are a display of love toward a deceased deity.

value.text: Reward for accepting the Tavern Challenge at The Cat's Tail and claiming victory in a Friendly Fracas with Rhodeia of Loch

value.name: Oceanid
value.desc:
A life-form created from condensed Hydro elements of incredible purity. Often attached to bodies of water.
It is said that as water bodies become purer, the Hydro elements within grow more abundant, causing the Oceanids to grow more powerful. It is also said by some that Oceanids were once sea creatures from a home far away who carried the fragments of a long-dead god to the many corners of this world. Perhaps they did this so that the love their god held for this world could be spread through the waters to all the land...

customize.name: Rhodeia of Loch
customize.desc:
"Lady of Clear Waters" Rhodeia

"As long as rain falls and rivers flow… water will exist forever…"

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.text: Can also be exchanged using a

customize.name: Blank Dynamic Card
customize.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Friendly Fracas - The Oceanid's Concern

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow." "Ah, the cat who wanders by the waters of Qingce Village told me the tale of the spirit of the water..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: "Rhodeia of Loch" is immune to Frozen, Stun, and Petrification, gains Elemental Lifeform: Hydro when the battle begins, and starts with the Talent Card "Streaming Surge" equipped.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow." "Ah, who would've thought that the disturbed Oceanid would turn the river water this bitter..."

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Randomly summons 1 <color=#ffffff>Oceanid Mimic</color> (Prioritizes summoning a different type from preexisting ones, at most 2 types of Oceanid Mimic can exist at the same time in the summons area).
<color=#ece5d8>Oceanid Mimic</color>
<color=#ffd780>Summons</color>
There are 3 kinds of Oceanid Mimics in total, and up 2 kinds can exist at once:
<color=#ffffff>Squirrel</color> : Deal 2 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> at the End Phase. 2 Usages.
<color=#ffffff>Raptor</color> : Deal 1 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> at the End Phase. 3 Usages.
<color=#ffffff>Frog</color> : Can take 1 DMG for active character. 1 Usage. Once this effect is depleted, deal 2 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> during the End Phase.

<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Randomly summons 2 <color=#ffffff>Oceanid Mimic</color> (Prioritizes summoning a different type from preexisting ones, at most 2 types of Oceanid Mimic can exist at the same time in the summons area).
<color=#ece5d8>Oceanid Mimic</color>
<color=#ffd780>Summons</color>
There are 3 kinds of Oceanid Mimics in total, and up 2 kinds can exist at once:
<color=#ffffff>Squirrel</color> : Deal 2 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> at the End Phase. 2 Usages.
<color=#ffffff>Raptor</color> : Deal 1 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> at the End Phase. 3 Usages.
<color=#ffffff>Frog</color> : Can take 1 DMG for active character. 1 Usage. Once this effect is depleted, deal 2 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> during the End Phase.

<color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst</color>
Deals 4 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> . For each friendly Summon on the field, deals +1 additional DMG.

<color=#ffd780>Summon</color>
Provides 2 <color=#ffffff>Shield</color> points for your active character. When this card's Shield points are depleted, it is not discarded.
During the End Phase, if this card's <color=#ffffff>Shield</color> s have been depleted:
Discard this card and deal 2 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color>
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s): 1</color>

Applies Hydro and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Vaporize</color> : DMG +2 for this instance
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Electro-Charged</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> <color=#ffffff>] Frozen</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, the target is unable to perform any Actions this Round (Can be removed in advance after the target receives +2 Physical or Pyro DMG)
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Bloom</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Dendro Core</color> ] that grants +2 DMG to the next instance of Pyro or Electro DMG

<color=#ece5d8>Usage(s)</color>
After this card's effect is triggered, 1 <color=#ffffff>Usage</color> of it will be consumed.
This card will be discarded immediately once it has 0 <color=#ffffff>Usages</color> remaining.
<color=#ece5d8>Shield</color>
This Shield will be consumed to protect the character who equips it from DMG.
